task_summary: The robot arm pours liquid from a wooden cup into a white mug on the workbench. It first locates and approaches the mug, then tilts and pours before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves an industrial robotic arm transferring contents from a wooden cup into a white ceramic mug. The workspace is a wooden table and the scene is static except for the robot. Key objects are the cup (held by the gripper or tool) and the mug (recipient). The robot must visually locate the mug, move to a pouring position above it, tilt the cup at a suitable angle, pour, and return to a neutral pose. Constraints include avoiding spillage and making sure the mug is properly targeted.
preconditions: Cup is firmly grasped by the robot
Mug is present and accessible on the table
No major obstacles around mug position
Robot arm is powered and calibrated
stepwise_plan: Verify mug visibility or detect it using sensors
Move end-effector above the mug at safe offset
Pour from cup into mug by tilting to 45 degrees at normal rate
Retreat arm from mug position once pouring is complete
success_criteria: Majority of contents transferred into mug without spillage
Robot returns to neutral or safe position
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect mug: reattempt detection or fallback to backup
Spillage detected: pause, adjust pose, and retry if possible
Object slipping: abort and secure grasp before retrying
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when pouring is finished and robot has retreated from mug.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible to robot sensors
Uses sensors to detect the mug if not already visible
Moves the end-effector to a safe position above the mug
Tilts the cup to pour its contents into the mug
Moves the robot away from the mug after pouring

failure_modes: Pouring misses mug or causes spillage
recovery_strategy: Retry mug detection if not visible
Adjust pose to re-align with mug if pouring failed
Abort and secure cup if slipped
Pause and replan if joint limits encountered
assumptions: Instruction does not specify amount to pour or rate; defaults assigned
Cup is already grasped by robot before pouring (per frames)
No liquid contents visually confirmed; assumed present per task context
No visible obstacles around mug in contact sheet

expected_success_criteria: Cup contents end up inside mug
